result.execSummary:
The defendant Danielle J A Kowatch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.
All financial obligations placed on payment plan $75 biweekly.
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail.

records.addlTxt: Offer to Settle

Defendant Danielle J A Kowatch in court with attorney Martin J Lipske.  Defendant Danielle J A Kowatch in custody appears by phone.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 17CF146,17CF100,16CF152,16CM76. Wants to appear by phone, no threat or force. know and vol waives right to be here in person. 17CF100 is DRI. Ct found her guilty. Ct was frustrated.  Ct talked about getting off the case. thought and ready to go on. Def wants Judge to go on. State complied with Vic rights. --Lawerance White-- happy case will be coming to an end.  ADA comments-- Charges pending in Price Co. Atty comments-- feel will be done and completed August 6 or 7 and sent to Price Co to take care of cases. Def sent a letter to Ct.. Ct rev'd letter. Ct orders-- see offer to settle-- serve 7 days in Price Co. Thinks will have a job--Cambria out oif MN will be pd every 2 weeks. can pay $75 biweekly.. Thinks there is a freeze on her bank acct. and that there is $500 for Church.. Atty comments --wants to live in Mn.Lives in St. Peters MN. Atty will DOC to see her at jail.
from def to court

Defendant Danielle J A Kowatch in court with attorney Martin J Lipske. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin.4 cases total. 17CF100 ARGN, 17CF146 PH. 17CF46 waives prelim, court finds prob cause case bound over. ADA has efiled and provided information to defense. Proceed to arraignment. Atty Lipske has recieved information, waives reading, plea NG, victims from case 16CF152 here, state has amended the offer to settle but he does not have the guilty plea questionaire completed. ADA there is a settlement agreement in the cases. Atty Lipske does want to go forward but does not have the plea questionaire completed.  
Offer to Settle spells out the agreement of the parties. Charges/penalties read. Def plead NC to each of the five counts. Elements of crime, admits that amount is greater than $2500. DRI 16CM76 Ct1, 16CF152 Ct1,4-6, state contends that there are mutliple counts that could have been charged but have not and will not be charged. 17CF100 both counts, 17CF146 Ct2. No threat/force, no MAS, no treatment, no difficulty understanding, 14yrs school, graduated HS, read/write/understand English, not employed. Atty Lipse discussed case with client, knowing/vol giving up right, all settlements, strengths and weaknesses, aggrivating/mitigating. Def agrees had those discussion, satisfied with representation, wants court to accept plea. Atty Lipske comments Ct accepts plea and finds  def guilty.  Ct reviews victim impact statement, victim in court, per ADA only addition is that victims feel def needs mental health counseling. ADA comments on sentencing. Atty Lipske comments on sentencing. Ct asks if Def understands when she plead no contest that she essentially admitted to stealing, does she admit to stealing. Def says no she did not, wants to move forward to this and have it done. Ct questions further. Ct states maybe recuse self, sounds incredible to him, because he on the local finance commity for Our lady of the Lake. Ct will not go forward today, not sure will accept plea. Atty Lipske issues with she beleived the priest has signed it but he stated that he had not signed it, financial records are there, she does want to get this over, believes this provided the basis for the charges and that she could be found guilty. Ct sentencing will not be done today, will review the case and see if he will accept plea.  Internal review scheduled for June 30, 2017 at 08:00 am.

Attorney Martin J Lipske in court for Defendant Danielle J A Kowatch. Prosecuting Atty Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Danielle J A Kowatch appeared by phone means. 4 cases total. Initial 17CF146 and Argn 17CF100. 17CF146 atty does not believe she has a copy, reads charges penalties, will provide copy to Def, waives reading, request prelim waives time limits. $1000 cash bail ordered on 6/5/17 covers both 17CF100 and 146. Prelim 6/29 3:30pm. Clerk to make sure  def needs to be here in person. Other cases track along. Argn 17CF100, Atty unsure if she has information. Argn for this case on 6/29 as well  Arraignment scheduled for June 29, 2017 at 03:30 pm.
